name: sonarlint-vscode
description: Advanced linter to detect & fix coding issues locally in JS/TS, Python, Java, C#, C/C++, Go, PHP.  Use with SonarQube (Server, Cloud) for optimal team performance.

^[^:]+:[^:]+$.markdownDescription: Property names are rule keys in the form: `repo:key`

level.markdownDescription: When set to `off`, disable the rule. When set to `on`, enable the rule.

parameters.markdownDescription: Rule parameters. See rule description for accepted parameters. E.g `{ "intParam": "123" }`.

sonarlint.connectedMode.servers.deprecationMessage: The setting is deprecated. Use `sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sonarqube` or `sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sonarcloud` instead.

serverId.description: A unique identifier for this server connection. Will be referenced from `#sonarlint.connectedMode.project#`

serverUrl.description: URL of the server. Use https://sonarcloud.io for SonarQube Cloud.

token.description: Token generated from My Account>Security in SonarQube (Server, Cloud)

sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sona.markdownDescription: Connect SonarQube for IDE to SonarQube Server to apply the same code quality and security standards as your team. Analyze more languages, detect more issues **on the whole project**, receive notifications about the quality gate status, and more. Quality Profiles and file exclusion settings defined on the server are shared between all connected users. Please find the documentation [here](https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarqube-for-vs-code/connect-your-ide/connected-mode/)

connectionId.description: A unique identifier for this connection to be used as a reference in `#sonarlint.connectedMode.project#`. Only needed if you plan to use multiple connections to SonarQube (Server, Cloud).

token.description: Token generated from 'My Account>Security' in SonarQube Server

disableNotifications.description: SonarQube for VS Code will show notifications for bound projects when there are new issues assigned to you, or when the quality gate status changed. Set to false to disable all notifications for projects bound to this connection.

sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sona.markdownDescription: Connect SonarQube for IDE to SonarQube Cloud to apply the same code quality and security standards as your team. Analyze more languages, detect more issues **on the whole project**, receive notifications about the quality gate status, and more. Quality Profiles and file exclusion settings defined on the server are shared between all connected users. Please find the documentation [here](https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarqube-for-vs-code/connect-your-ide/connected-mode/)

connectionId.description: A unique identifier for this connection to be used as a reference in `#sonarlint.connectedMode.project#`. Only needed if you plan to use multiple connections to SonarQube (Server, Cloud).

region.description: Region of the SonarQube Cloud instance. Use 'US' for `sonarqube.us`, 'EU' for `sonarcloud.io`.

organizationKey.description: A SonarQube Cloud organization key. If you want to bind different projects that are in different organizations, simply declare multiple connections.

token.description: Token generated from 'My Account>Security' in SonarQube Cloud

disableNotifications.description: SonarQube for VS Code will show notifications for bound projects when there are new issues assigned to you, or when the quality gate status changed. Set to false to disable all notifications for projects bound to this connection.

sonarlint.connectedMode.project.markdownDescription:
Bind the current workspace folder to a [SonarQube Server](command:SonarLint.HelpAndFeedbackLinkClicked?%22sonarQubeProductPage%22) or [SonarQube Cloud](command:SonarLint.HelpAndFeedbackLinkClicked?%5B%7B%22id%22%3A%22sonarCloudProductPage%22%2C%22utm%22%3A%7B%22content%22%3A%22settings-connected-mode%22%2C%22term%22%3A%22bind-current-workspace%22%7D%7D%5D) project. Requires connection details to be defined in the setting `#sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sonarqube#` or `#sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sonarcloud#`.

Binding a workspace folder to a server project allows SonarQube for VS Code to match, as much as possible, the same rules and settings as found on the server, and hence share the analysis configuration with other contributors.

Example:

    "sonarlint.connectedMode.project": {
      "projectKey": "my_project",
      "connectionId":"my_connection_id"
    }

serverId.description: Identifier of the server connection declared in `#sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sonarqube#` or `#sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sonarcloud#`

projectKey.description: Key of the project in SonarQube (Server, Cloud)

connectionId.description: Identifier of the server connection declared in `#sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sonarqube#` or `#sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sonarcloud#`

projectKey.description: Key of the project in SonarQube Server or SonarQube Cloud (can be found on project homepage)

sonarlint.automaticAnalysis.markdownDescription: Enable or disable on-the-fly analysis of files you work on. When enabled, SonarQube for IDE will automatically analyze open files and show findings in real-time.

sonarlint.pathToNodeExecutable.markdownDescription:
Path to a Node.js executable (versions above 20.12.0, or 22.11.0) used to analyze JavaScript and TypeScript code. 
On Windows, backslashes must be escaped, e.g. `C:\\Program Files\\NodeJS\\20-lts\\bin\\node.exe`

sonarlint.pathToCompileCommands.markdownDescription: Path to the active compilation database, e.g. `C:\\Repos\\MyProject\\compile_commands.json`

sonarlint.testFilePattern.markdownDescription:
Files whose name match this [glob pattern](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/io/fileOps.html#glob) are considered as test files by analyzers. Most rules are *not* evaluated on test files.

In [Connected Mode](command:SonarLint.HelpAndFeedbackLinkClicked?%22connectedModeDocs%22), this setting is configured **on the server-side** and shared among all contributors.

Example: `**/test/**,**/*test*,**/*Test*`

sonarlint.analysisExcludesStandalone.markdownDescription: Files whose name match this [glob pattern](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/io/fileOps.html#glob) will not be processed by analyzers. In [Connected Mode](command:SonarLint.HelpAndFeedbackLinkClicked?%22connectedModeDocs%22) with SonarQube Server or SonarQube Cloud, this property will be ignored and the server's exclusion settings will be applied. No rules are evaluated on excluded files. Example: `**/lib/**,**/*generated*`

sonarlint.ls.javaHome.markdownDescription:
Path to a Java Runtime Environment (17 or more recent) used to launch the SonarQube for VS Code Language Server.
* On Windows, backslashes must be escaped, e.g. `C:\\Program Files\\Java\\jdk-17` 
* On macOS, this path should include the `/Contents/Home` directory, e.g `/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/corretto-17.0.5/Contents/Home`

sonarlint.ls.vmargs.markdownDescription: Extra JVM arguments used to launch the SonarLint Language Server. e.g. `-Xmx1024m`

sonarlint.output.showVerboseLogs.description: Enable verbose log level in the SonarQube for IDE output.

sonarlint.analyzerProperties.markdownDescription: Extra properties that could be passed to the code analyzers. Only for advanced use cases.

sonarlint.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VS Code and the SonarLint language server.

sonarlint.disableTelemetry.markdownDescription: Disable sending anonymous usage statistics to SonarSource. Click [here](https://github.com/SonarSource/sonarlint-vscode/blob/master/telemetry-sample.md) to see a sample of the data that are collected.

sonarlint.focusOnNewCode.markdownDescription:
If enabled, by default, [focusing on new code](https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarqube-for-vs-code/using/investigating-issues/#focusing-on-new-code) shows issues introduced in the last 30 days.

For the most accurate and customizable new code definition, use [Connected Mode](https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarqube-for-vs-code/connect-your-ide/connected-mode) with SonarQube (Server, Cloud).

sonarlint.earlyAccess.showRegionSelectio.markdownDescription: Show region selection while creating SonarQube Cloud Connection

sonarlint.startFlightRecorder.markdownDescription:
Start the language server's flight recorder mode.

⚠ **This feature shares detailed information with SonarSource (logs, telemetry events) that may include _confidential_ data, only enable if requested to help investigate an issue.**

commands.title: Reopen Local Issues for current file
Configure the compilation database for C and C++ analysis
Bind all workspace folders to SonarQube (Server, Cloud)
Open Taint Vulnerability on remote server
Enable Verbose Logging and Show Output

viewsWelcome.contents:
No locations to show.
Select a SonarQube issue in the "SonarQube" view.
[Show Findings](command:SonarQube.Findings.focus)

[Connected Mode](command:SonarLint.HelpAndFeedbackLinkClicked?%22connectedModeDocs%22) links SonarQube for IDE to SonarQube Server or SonarQube Cloud projects. 

[Connect to SonarQube Server](command:SonarLint.ConnectToSonarQube)
[Connect to SonarQube Cloud](command:SonarLint.ConnectToSonarCloud)

Analyze more languages, detect more issues on the whole project, receive notifications about the quality gate status, and more.

Configure SonarQube integration with AI agents to enhance your development experience.

[Configure SonarQube MCP Server](command:SonarLint.ConfigureMCPServer)

How does it work? [Read more](command:SonarLint.HelpAndFeedbackLinkClicked?%22aiAgentsConfigurationDoc%22)

Automatically find and fix code quality and security issues as you write, using powerful linting tools built right into your code editor.

[Get Started with SonarQube for IDE](command:SonarLint.HelpAndFeedbackLinkClicked?%22sonarLintWalkthrough%22) $(arrow-right)

walkthroughs.title: Welcome to SonarQube for IDE!
walkthroughs.description:
Start left and discover issues early.
SonarQube for IDE empowers you to find & fix code issues in real time, in 15+ languages.

steps.title: $(rocket) New to SonarQube?
steps.description:
Unlock more languages and security rules.
[Create Free Account](command:SonarLint.HelpAndFeedbackLinkClicked?%5B%7B%22id%22%3A%22sonarqubeCloudFreeSignUp%22%2C%22utm%22%3A%7B%22content%22%3A%22walkthrough-welcome-sq-ide%22%2C%22term%22%3A%22create-free-account%22%7D%7D%5D)

steps.title: $(shield) Taint Vulnerabilities and More
steps.description:
Enable advanced analysis (including [Taint Vulnerabilities](https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarqube-for-vs-code/using/taint-vulnerabilities/) and wider language support) by connecting to SonarQube (Server, Cloud). Also, benefit from the [AI CodeFix](https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarqube-for-vs-code/ai-capabilities/ai-codefix) within your IDE.
[Set up Connection](command:SonarLint.ConnectedMode.focus)

steps.title: $(comment-discussion) Share feedback or ask for help
steps.description: You'd like to learn more about SonarQube for IDE, or give us feedback? Check out the [Help and Feedback view](command:SonarLint.HelpAndFeedback.focus).

steps.title: $(bug) Enough theory, let's fix some code!
steps.description:
Open our sample file and get started instantly:
[Open Sample File](command:SonarLint.OpenSample)
Check the [Problems view](command:workbench.panel.markers.view.focus): SonarQube has found something $(warning).
Right-click on the issue.
Show issue details: SonarQube explains why this is an issue.
For certain rules and issues, SonarQube for IDE will suggest available Quick Fixes.

view/item/context.title: Add Project Binding
view/item/context.when: view == SonarLint.ConnectedMode && viewItem == sonarcloudConnection || viewItem == sonarqubeConnection

view/item/context.title: Remove
view/item/context.when: view == SonarLint.ConnectedMode && viewItem == sonarcloudConnection || viewItem == sonarqubeConnection

view/item/context.title: Clear Highlighting
view/item/context.when: view == SonarQube.Findings && viewItem == newHotspotItem || viewItem == knownHotspotItem

view/item/context.title: Open Taint Vulnerability on remote server
view/item/context.when: view == SonarQube.Findings && viewItem == taintVulnerabilityItem || viewItem == AICodeFixableTaintItem

view/item/context.title: Resolve issue as...
view/item/context.when: view == SonarQube.Findings && viewItem == taintVulnerabilityItem || viewItem == AICodeFixableTaintItem

view/item/context.title: Configure MCP Server
view/item/context.when: sonarqube.mcpServerSupportedAgent && view == SonarLint.ConnectedMode && (viewItem == sonarcloudConnection || viewItem == sonarqubeConnection)

colors.description: Background color for highlighted secondary locations of SonarLint issues
Text color for secondary location index of SonarLint issues
Background color for secondary location index of SonarLint issues
Text color for active secondary location index of SonarLint issues
Background color for active secondary location index of SonarLint issues

languageModelTools.name: sonarqube_list_potential_security_issues
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool returns a list of potential security issues (Security Hotspots and Taint Vulnerabilities) in a given file. It runs SonarQube analysis on the file and returns a list of Security Hotspots detected with their location and error message. Additionally, it lists Taint Vulnerabilities detected by SonarQube Server or Cloud analysis.

filePath.description: The full path to the file for which the potential security issues are to be listed.

languageModelTools.name: sonarqube_exclude_from_analysis
languageModelTools.displayName: SonarQube: Exclude File or Folder from Analysis
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool modifies the SonarQube for IDE configuration to exclude files matching a given glob pattern from analysis.

globPattern.description: Oracle glob pattern to exclude files or folders from analysis. For example, `**/test/**` to exclude all files in the test folder.

languageModelTools.name: sonarqube_setup_connected_mode
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool guides the user through the process of setting up Connected Mode in SonarQube for IDE. It provides instructions and prompts and runs necessary commands to help the user connect their IDE to a SonarQube Server or Cloud.

workspaceFolder.description: Path to the workspace folder in VS Code for which the user wants to set up Connected Mode. If only one workspace folder is open, it will be used by default.

isSonarQubeCloud.description: Indicates whether the user wants to connect to SonarQube Cloud. If true, the user will be prompted for the organization key. If false, the user will be prompted for the server URL of their SonarQube Server.

serverUrl.description: URL of the SonarQube Server instance to connect to. Required if user wants to connect to a SonarQube Server. Example: `https://sonarqube.example.com`.

organizationKey.description: Key of the SonarQube Cloud organization to connect to. Required if user wants to connect to a SonarQube Cloud. Example: `my-organization`.

projectKey.description: Key of the SonarQube Server or Cloud project to bind to the workspace folder. This is used to set up the project binding in Connected Mode.

languageModelTools.name: sonarqube_analyze_file
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool opens the requested file and runs SonarQube analysis on it. Detected code quality and security issues will be reported in the Problems view of the IDE. It can be used to analyze any file including those that are not part of a workspace or those that are excluded from the analysis. Do not call this method to analyze Jupyter Notebook.

filePath.description: The full path to the file that should be analyzed.
